channel.title: Journal.ie – Daily 9-at-9 Mirror
channel.description: Locally mirrored feed of TheJournal.ie Daily 9-at-9 bulletins.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Sunday
item.description: US seizes second oil tanker off Venezuela, a man has died after a Westmeath collision, an Australia PM orders review after Bondi Beach attack

item.title: The 9 at 9: Saturday
item.description: More Epstein files released, US strikes Islamic State in Syria, and David Walliams dropped by publisher.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Friday
item.description: EU leaders strike €90bn Ukraine deal, Australia to introduce gun buyback scheme after Bondi Beach attack, and trade deal between the EU and Mercosur delayed

item.title: The 9 at 9: Thursday
item.description: ESRI warns government didn’t pay attention to Budget concerns, gardaí to launch tasers pilot and crunch EU Summit on support for Ukraine

item.title: The 9 at 9: Monday
item.description: Rob Reiner and his wife killed, Bondi gunmenmay have links to the Islamic State, and derelict buildings still derelict.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Saturday
item.description: Status Yellow warning, Irish Air Corps shortfall, and Irish Euromillions winner. This morning’s top stories.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Thursday
item.description: Here’s all the news you need to know as you start your day.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Tuesday
item.description: Here’s all the news you need to know as you start your day.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Monday
item.description: Probe into deadly Offaly fire continues, Zelenskyy in London and Ellen Walshe makes history at swimming championships

item.title: The 9 at 9: Sunday
item.description: A fatal house fire in Offaly, Government writes to landlords, and support for Fine Gael slumps.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Saturday
item.description: Here’s all the news you need to know as you start your day.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Sunday
item.description: Shooting in California, bluetongue virus detected, and debate over name of Herzog Park.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Thursday
item.description: Cost-rental apartment mishap, shooting near the White House, and weather warnings.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Wednesday
item.description: Immigration reform, HP layoffs, and government spending “like there’s no tomorrow”.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Tuesday
item.description: Dublin City Council votes for rent hikes, Michael Shine scoping inquiry to come, and uncertainty about Zelenskyy’s Ireland visit.

item.title: The 8 at 8: Friday
item.description: Funerals for two Dundalk crash victims to take place later, Ireland to make G20 debut, and Frida Kahlo painting sets new record

item.title: The 9 at 9: Thursday
item.description: Garda arrested, frosty weather in northern counties, and Epstein files to be released.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Wednesday
item.description: Yates faces media committee, a new cross-border college, and a snow-ice warning.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Tuesday
item.description: Woman dead and man in critical condition after Cork stabbing, UN approves Trump’s Gaza peace plan, and ‘Arctic air mass’ settles over the country

item.title: The 9 at 9: Sunday
item.description: Fatal crash in Louth, crucial Ireland soccer match today and Galway win big at camogie All-Stars

item.title: The 9 at 9: Saturday
item.description: Storm Claudia departs, Labour party hosts annual conference and Trump threatens BBC with $5 billion lawsuit

item.title: The 9 at 9: Friday
item.description: A Status Orange weather warning, the BBC apologises to Trump and Puffins are back in Co Antrim

item.title: The 9 at 9: Thursday
item.description: Housing plan on the way today, climate targets missed and US government shutdown ends

item.title: The 9 at 9: Wednesday
item.description: Rents rising, housing plan to be signed off and Trump threatens BBC with billion-dollar legal action

item.title: The 9 at 9: Tuesday
item.description: Connolly to be sworn in as President, government’s new housing plan finally signed off and rain warnings in place
